definition: lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: The market-place was full of women, the streets packed with men.
sentences.chinese: 商场里妇女摩肩接踵，街上男人比比皆是。

sentences.english: There were thousands of people inside and very crowed. People moved very slowly.
sentences.chinese: 超市里人山人海，摩肩接踵，人们移动地非常缓慢。

sentences.english: People have to climb the mountain, the mountain people is the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 人们纷纷地爬上山，上山的人已经是摩肩接踵了。

sentences.english: Night, walking in the town of quartzite on the road, visitors are filled.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，走在小镇的青石板路上，游人摩肩接踵。
所有的职位都已摩肩接踵？

sentences.english: The bus was jam-packed with people and I could not move.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车里摩肩接踵，我被挤在里面无法动弹。

sentences.english: No one intrudes on the others, even if in a jostling crowd.
sentences.chinese: 尽管摩肩接踵，大家也挤不到一处。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
crowded to bursting point/filled to overflowing/jam-packed
